page.title: 10Slate Quarries
page.content: LANDSCAPE IN THE DELABOLE AREA. {Slate Quarries. In addition to the big quarry at Delabole this area is pock-marked with smaller quarries, many now disused, but some still in production, notably {Trebarwith Road}and the{Prince of {Wales.}Whereas the true Delabole slate is blue-grey, these other quarries produce{"rustic slate",}where mineral- laden water has penetrated the strata and left beautiful orange and rust-coloured deposits. This stone is not durable enough for roofing slate and is used for building, wall and floor tiles, crazy paving, fireplaces and Cornish "hedges". At the{Prince of {Wales Quarry}(on Duchy land) 8 men are employed. The beds worked are a few feet below groundlevel. The stone is cut into metre squares,levered out and split with bettle and chisel.
